Interface_name: WebSocket Server based on Java EE
Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a WebSocket server endpoint in Java to handle real-time communication between clients, manage client connections, and broadcast messages to all connected clients.

Class Description: MyWebSocket is a Java class that serves as a WebSocket server endpoint. It maintains a list of connected clients, handles connection events, processes incoming messages, and broadcasts messages to all connected clients while also logging messages to a database.

Attributes:
- onlineCount: [static int] - Tracks the number of currently connected clients
- webSocketSet: [static CopyOnWriteArraySet<MyWebSocket>] - Thread-safe set containing all active WebSocket sessions
- session: [Session] - Represents the WebSocket session for a connected client
- contentService: [ContentService] - Service for persisting messages to a database (autowired via Spring)

Methods:
- onOpen: [onOpen]([Session session]) -> [void] - Handles new client connections, adds session to the set, and increments online count
- onClose: [onClose]() -> [void] - Handles client disconnections, removes session from the set, and decrements online count
- onMessage: [onMessage]([String message, Session session]) -> [void] - Processes incoming messages and broadcasts them to all connected clients
- onError: [onError]([Session session, Throwable error]) -> [void] - Handles any errors that occur during WebSocket communication
- sendMessage: [sendMessage]([String message]) -> [void] - Sends a message to the client and persists it to the database
- getOnlineCount: [getOnlineCount]() -> [int] - Returns the current number of connected clients (synchronized)
- addOnlineCount: [addOnlineCount]() -> [void] - Increments the online client count (synchronized)
- subOnlineCount: [subOnlineCount]() -> [void] - Decrements the online client count (synchronized)
